I think addShutdownHook has two problems:
1. The scope is too far reaching =
for many cases.  Imagine if you were running a test suite periodically from=
 a long-running process, such as Ant.
2. I bet many people using JUnit don'=
t even know about shutdown hooks.  It seems much more friendly to use a @Af=
terSuite than to wire up shutdown hooks, implement a Runnable, etc.

What d=
o you think?

Thanks, 
Adam
